filmography.title: The Men
filmography.role_description: A bitter, paraplegic World War II lieutenant struggling to adjust to civilian life and his new disability.
filmography.plot: A paralyzed war veteran faces the physical and emotional challenges of rehabilitation while trying to rebuild his relationship with his fiancée.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: A Streetcar Named Desire
filmography.role_description: A brutish, animalistic working-class man whose clash with his fragile sister-in-law exposes the raw nerves of class and desire.
filmography.plot: Disturbed Blanche DuBois moves in with her sister in New Orleans and is tormented by her brutish brother-in-law while her reality crumbles.

filmography.title: Viva Zapata!
filmography.role_description: The legendary Mexican revolutionary who rises from peasant roots to lead a revolt against a corrupt dictatorship.
filmography.plot: Mexican revolutionary Emiliano Zapata leads a peasant uprising against the corrupt presidency of Porfirio Díaz.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor; Cannes: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Julius Caesar
filmography.role_description: A loyal friend to Caesar who uses his oratorical skills to turn the Roman populace against the conspirators who assassinated him.
filmography.plot: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar leads a group of senators to assassinate him, sparking a civil war led by Mark Antony.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: On the Waterfront
filmography.role_description: A washed-up prizefighter turned longshoreman who struggles with his conscience before standing up to a corrupt union boss.
filmography.plot: An ex-prize fighter turned longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama); BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: Guys and Dolls
filmography.role_description: A smooth-talking, high-rolling gambler who takes a bet to woo a straight-laced missionary, leading to unexpected romance.
filmography.plot: A gambler is challenged to take a cold female missionary to Havana, but they fall for each other, and the bet has a hidden motive.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Motion Picture (Musical/Comedy)

filmography.title: Sayonara
filmography.role_description: A Korean War fighter pilot stationed in Japan who challenges military prejudice by falling in love with a Japanese dancer.
filmography.plot: An American Air Force major in Kobe, Japan falls in love with a Japanese dancer, defying military regulations and social taboos.

filmography.title: The Young Lions
filmography.role_description: A disillusioned German ski instructor turned Wehrmacht officer who becomes increasingly horrified by the war and Nazism.
filmography.plot: The destiny of three soldiers during World War II: a German officer, a Jewish-American G.I., and a showbiz crooner.

filmography.title: One-Eyed Jacks
filmography.role_description: An outlaw betrayed by his partner who seeks revenge after spending years in a Mexican prison, only to find his enemy is now a sheriff.
filmography.plot: After robbing a Mexican bank, Dad Longworth takes the loot and leaves his partner Rio to be captured, but Rio eventually escapes and searches for revenge.
filmography.awards: San Sebastián International Film Festival: Win – Golden Shell (Best Film)

filmography.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
filmography.role_description: An aristocratic first lieutenant who leads a mutiny against the sadistic Captain Bligh during a voyage to Tahiti.
filmography.plot: In 1787, the HMS Bounty sets sail for Tahiti under the command of the tyranny of Captain Bligh, whose cruelty leads to a mutiny led by Fletcher Christian.

filmography.title: Reflections in a Golden Eye
filmography.role_description: A latent homosexual Army major stationed in the South who struggles with his repressed desires and a volatile marriage.
filmography.plot: An army major represses his homosexuality while his wife has an affair with a fellow officer on a military base in the South.

filmography.title: The Godfather
filmography.role_description: The aging, rasping patriarch of an organized crime dynasty who transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.
filmography.plot: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor (Refused); Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Last Tango in Paris
filmography.role_description: A grieving American widower in Paris who enters into an anonymous, purely sexual relationship with a young French woman.
filmography.plot: A young Parisian woman meets a middle-aged American businessman who demands their clandestine relationship be based only on sex.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; NYFCC: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Superman
filmography.role_description: The wise, dignified biological father of Superman who sends his infant son to Earth to save him from the destruction of Krypton.
filmography.plot: An alien orphan is sent from his dying planet to Earth, where he grows up to become his adoptive home's first and greatest superhero.
filmography.awards: Highest Paid Actor World Record (at time)

filmography.title: Apocalypse Now
filmography.role_description: A rogue, enigmatic Special Forces colonel who has gone insane and set himself up as a god-like figure in the Cambodian jungle.
filmography.plot: A U.S. Army officer serving in Vietnam is tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel who sees himself as a god.
filmography.awards: Considered one of his most iconic later roles

filmography.title: A Dry White Season
filmography.role_description: A weary, cynical human rights lawyer in apartheid-era South Africa who agrees to take on a hopeless case for a black family.
filmography.plot: A white South African school teacher hires a lawyer to investigate the disappearance of his black gardener's son after he is detained by the police.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor
